Travis Dudding: * Indicates primary offering of a cross listed course
Cara Krezek: BTEC 2P09

Travis Dudding: Introduction to Biotechnology
Cara Krezek: Traditional and modern biotechnology. Topics include fermentation processes, medical, agricultural and forensic applications; as well as gene cloning and expression.

Travis Dudding: Note: materials fee required. This course may be offered in multiple modes of delivery. The method of delivery will be listed on the academic timetable, in the applicable term.
Cara Krezek: #BTEC 2P63

Travis Dudding: Introduction to Biophysical Chemistry
Cara Krezek: Physical chemistry as applied to biological sciences. Introductory thermodynamics, kinetics, equilibria, and transport phenomena as applied to proteins, biological membranes and other biological systems. Laboratory work includes kinetic measurements, equilibrium constant measurements and protein purification and characterization.

Travis Dudding: Note: materials fee required. This course may be offered in multiple modes of delivery. The method of delivery will be listed on the academic timetable, in the applicable term.
Cara Krezek: BTEC 3P09

Travis Dudding: Bioreactor Processes
Cara Krezek: Fermentation technology and bioprocessing; the kinetics and thermodynamics of fermentation. Topics include batch and continuous fermentation, biomass production (single-cell proteins), immobilized systems, by-product recovery and scale-up.

Travis Dudding: Note: materials fee required. This course may be offered in multiple modes of delivery. The method of delivery will be listed on the academic timetable, in the applicable term.
Cara Krezek: #BTEC 3P43

Travis Dudding: Applied Microbiology
Cara Krezek: Ecology of micro-organisms and special adaptations that permit their use in biotechnology and applied microbiology.

Travis Dudding: Note: materials fee required. This course may be offered in multiple modes of delivery. The method of delivery will be listed on the academic timetable, in the applicable term.
Cara Krezek: #BTEC 3P50

Travis Dudding: Molecular Genetics
Cara Krezek: Topics include the genetic code and information flow from nucleic acids to proteins, RNA and protein synthesis; prokaryotic and eukaryotic chromosomes; gene organization; transcription, RNA processing; codon usage; enhancer and transposons.

Travis Dudding: Note: materials fee required. This course may be offered in multiple modes of delivery. The method of delivery will be listed on the academic timetable, in the applicable term.
Cara Krezek: #BTEC 3P62

Travis Dudding: Bio-organic Chemistry
Cara Krezek: Mechanistic description of the biosynthesis and metabolism of natural products including alkaloids, terpenes and acetate-derived compounds. Selected examples of biologically/medicinally active classes of natural products along with their physiological modes of activity.

Travis Dudding: Note: this course may be offered in multiple modes of delivery. The method of delivery will be listed on the academic timetable, in the applicable term.
Cara Krezek: #BTEC 3P93

Travis Dudding: Protein and Nucleic Acid Chemistry
Cara Krezek: Note: this course may be offered in multiple modes of delivery. The method of delivery will be listed on the academic timetable, in the applicable term.

Travis Dudding: BTEC 4F90
Cara Krezek: Research Project

Travis Dudding: Experimental research carried out under faculty supervision.
Cara Krezek: Restriction: permission of the Director.

Travis Dudding: Note: this course may be offered in multiple modes of delivery. The method of delivery will be listed on the academic timetable, in the applicable term.
Cara Krezek: BTEC 4F91

Travis Dudding: Thesis
Cara Krezek: Incorporates results of the research project and will form the basis of a seminar presented by the student.

Travis Dudding: Restriction: open to BTEC majors with approval to year 4 (honours).
Cara Krezek: Note: this course may be offered in multiple modes of delivery. The method of delivery will be listed on the academic timetable, in the applicable term.

Travis Dudding: #BTEC 4P06
Cara Krezek: Bioinformatics

Travis Dudding: Sequence analysis, phylogeny, databases and tools, functional genomics, genome project, basic bioformatics programming.
Cara Krezek: Restriction: students must have a minimum of 14.0 overall credits or approval to year 4 (honours).

Travis Dudding: #BTEC 4P08
Cara Krezek: Topics in Plant and Microbial Biotechnology

Travis Dudding: Characterization of biochemical processes and structures. Genetic modification of such processes and structures through molecular manipulation to meet scientific and/or societal needs. Examples include yeast and microbial enzymes or enzyme systems as well as crop proteins and enzymes.
Cara Krezek: Note: this course may be offered in multiple modes of delivery. The method of delivery will be listed on the academic timetable, in the applicable term.

Travis Dudding: #BTEC 4P11
Cara Krezek: Theory of Techniques in Biochemistry and Molecular Biology

Travis Dudding: Theory behind basic and some advanced techniques in nucleic acid and protein manipulations and analysis.
Cara Krezek: Note: this course may be offered in multiple modes of delivery. The method of delivery will be listed on the academic timetable, in the applicable term.

Travis Dudding: #BTEC 4P20
Cara Krezek: Synthetic Biology

Travis Dudding: Technological and engineering advances in the biological sciences, along with tools and discoveries stemming from them. Induced pluripotent stem cells, CRISPR/Cas9-based genome editing, optogenetic control of cellular communication, engineering the immune response, programmable DNA-based materials and engineered biosensors.
Cara Krezek: Note: this course may be offered in multiple modes of delivery. The method of delivery will be listed on the academic timetable, in the applicable term.

Travis Dudding: #BTEC 4P25
Cara Krezek: Concepts in Bioremediation and Biocommodities

Travis Dudding: Waste-management technologies that utilize biological agents (such as micro-organisms and plants) to treat hazardous contaminants and produce biocommodities. Biological, biogeochemical and engineering concepts in the design of technologies.
Cara Krezek: Prerequisite(s): open to students holding 15 or more credits.

Travis Dudding: *BTEC 4P26
Cara Krezek: Toxicological Chemistry and Biochemistry

Travis Dudding: Principles of toxicology. Key enzymes involved in the metabolism and biotransformation of xenobiotics. Actions of xenbiotics on nucleic acids, proteins and lipids. Biochemical mechanisms of the toxicity of selected xenobiotics such as toxins, common toxic chemicals, drugs and pesticides. Identification of xenobiotics in biological systems.
Cara Krezek: Restriction: students must have a minimum of 10.0 overall credits.

Travis Dudding: Note: this course may be offered in multiple modes of delivery. The method of delivery will be listed on the academic timetable, in the applicable term.
Cara Krezek: #BTEC 4P27

Travis Dudding: Enzyme and Co-enzyme Mechanisms
Cara Krezek: Hydrolytic and other processes catalyzed by enzymes lacking non-protein prosthetic groups; transferase reactions involving biotin, pyridoxal phosphate, thiamine pyrophosphate, folic acid and cobalamin; oxidation mechanisms involving pyridine nucleotides, flavoenzymes, hydroperoxidases and oxygenases.

Travis Dudding: Note: this course may be offered in multiple modes of delivery. The method of delivery will be listed on the academic timetable, in the applicable term.
Cara Krezek: *BTEC 4P28

Travis Dudding: Bio-organic Chemistry: Carbohydrates and Nucleic Acids
Cara Krezek: Topics include mono and oligosaccharides, preparative carbohydrate chemistry, neoglycoconjugates, immunochemistry of carbohydrates, nucleosides and nucleotides, oligonucleotide synthesis, medicinal chemistry of oligonucleotides, amino acids, protein structures, peptide chemistry and post-translational modifications.

Travis Dudding: Note: this course may be offered in multiple modes of delivery. The method of delivery will be listed on the academic timetable, in the applicable term.
Cara Krezek: #BTEC 4P41

Travis Dudding: Human Molecular Genetics
Cara Krezek: Principles of human genetics, human genome organization, pedigree, disease gene mapping, forensic and cancer genetics, genome sequencing, personal genomics.

Travis Dudding: Restriction: students must have a minimum of 14.0 overall credits or approval to year 4 (honours).
Cara Krezek: Note: this course may be offered in multiple modes of delivery. The method of delivery will be listed on the academic timetable, in the applicable term.

Travis Dudding: #BTEC 4P42
Cara Krezek: RNA World

Travis Dudding: Examination of various aspects of RNA (ribonucleic acid) function and evolution. Examination of evidence that RNA precedes DNA as the hereditary material and played a crucial role in the early evolution of life on Earth.
Cara Krezek: Note: this course may be offered in multiple modes of delivery. The method of delivery will be listed on the academic timetable, in the applicable term.

Travis Dudding: #BTEC 4P51
Cara Krezek: Molecular Virology

Travis Dudding: Bacterial and animal viruses. Topics include biochemical properties, virus-host interaction, productive cycle, effect of virus on host cell and organism, viral vectors and gene therapy, recombinant viral vaccines and origin of virus.
Cara Krezek: Note: this course may be offered in multiple modes of delivery. The method of delivery will be listed on the academic timetable, in the applicable term.

Travis Dudding: #BTEC 4P57
Cara Krezek: Bacterial Genetics

Travis Dudding: Molecular and transmission genetics of bacteria. Bacterial genetics from early descriptions of transformation and transduction to current developments in molecular genetics.
Cara Krezek: Note: this course may be offered in multiple modes of delivery. The method of delivery will be listed on the academic timetable, in the applicable term.

Travis Dudding: #BTEC 4P58
Cara Krezek: Fungal Genetics

Travis Dudding: Transmission and molecular genetics of fungi. Recent advances in gene manipulation and the contribution of studies on these organisms to general genetic principles.
Cara Krezek: Note: this course may be offered in multiple modes of delivery. The method of delivery will be listed on the academic timetable, in the applicable term.

Travis Dudding: #BTEC 4P67
Cara Krezek: Biophysical Techniques

Travis Dudding: Modern instrumental methods of biotechnology emphasizing understanding theory. Development of newer technologies which utilize biological components. Topics include optical, X-ray and NMR techniques, separation techniques, hybridization assays, immunoassays, biosensors and mass spectral techniques; membrane chemistry.
Cara Krezek: Note: this course may be offered in multiple modes of delivery. The method of delivery will be listed on the academic timetable, in the applicable term.
